content.raw:
I just met with Michael discussing how to deal with this issue/pull request.

For the most part things just need to be reorganized a bit. This is mainly because we don't want to have a test that's required to pass on the basis of having bedToBigBed installed. Having a test for this is not a bad idea, but there should be a test that simply warns when bedToBigBed is not installed and fails gracefully.

The one-liner change to layer.py and the .bed changes we would want to keep. We can't keep the bigbed binary file because it will cause the test to fail unless bedToBigBed is installed. The .bb test should be in a separate test that warns when bedToBigBed is not installed and otherwise run basically what is originally shown here.

If you just take out the .bb binary and revert the run.sh changes we'll pull the fix in right away. I can put the separate test writing on stuff that needs to be done but if you'd like to submit code for that test in this same pull request as well I'd be very grateful for it.
